p: Most diterpenes found in Hyptidinae are of the abietane type, although some labdane, isopimarane and kaurane have also been reported. Their structures are shown in Fig. 1 . The first studies were published in the years 1970, and reported the isolation of horminone ( 1), 14-methoxytaxodione ( 2) and hyptol ( 3) from Eplingiella fruticosa (Salzm. ex Benth.) Harley & J.F.B.Pastore (syn. Hyptis fruticosa Salzm. ex Benth) ( Marletti et al., 1976) . Suaveolic acid ( 4) and suaveolol ( 5) were obtained from the leaves of Mesosphaerum suaveolens (syn. Hyptis suaveolens) ( Manchand et al., 1974; Prawatsri et al., 2013). The last mentioned species also afforded 13 α- epi-dioxiabiet-8(14)-en-18-ol ( 6) ( Chukwujekwu et al., 2005), isosuaveolic acid ( 7), 8 α,9 α-epoxysuaveolic acid ( 8) and 14- O-methylsuaveolic acid ( 9) ( Prawatsri et al., 2013). In 1990, umbrosone ( 10) was obtained from Mesosphaerum sidifolium (L.Hérit) Harley & J.F.B.Pastore (syn. Hyptis umbrosa Salzm. ex Benth .) ( Delle Monache et al., 1990).
